description: The course involves investigating issues in global health from a quantitative, research-oriented perspective. Additional course material focuses on global public health issues and methods for analyzing health data. Students work on projects with researchers from the World Health Organization in Geneva, Switzerland, where they learn about the global burden of disease and how statisticians and epidemiologists can contribute to finding solutions. Students also have the opportunity to explore the art and culture of Paris for a weekend while in France. Prerequisite: Statistics 272. Offered in 2010-11 and alternate interims.
